thread.title: Umpqua Community College shooting victim identified
thread.title_full: Umpqua Community College shooting victim identified - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Umpqua Community College shooting victim identified
text:
Maria Leticia Alcaraz/via Facebook Lucero Alcaraz (c.), was one of the victims who died in Thursday's shooting at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg, Ore. One of the victims gunned down at an Oregon college Thursday was a 19-year-old student who dreamed of becoming a pediatric nurse.
Lucero Alcaraz was one of nine people killed on the Umpqua Community College campus in Roseburg, her family told Buzzfeed.
Alcaraz’ 14-year-old sister, Eileen, said the first-year college student was “the responsible one” of the family’s six siblings.
elexissanchez/via Twitter Alcaraz was a first-year-student who dreamed of becoming a nurse. Police shot and killed gunman Chris Harper Mercer after his bloody Thursday rampage. The 26-year-old stormed the campus with three pistols and a rifle and handed off a thumb drive and a stack of papers to someone before he began shooting.
Witnesses said Mercer asked his victims about their religious beliefs before the opened fire. He shot people who identified as Christians in the head. People who said they belonged to another religion — or gave no answer at all — were shot in other places, like their legs, witnesses said.
Michael Sullivan/AP Authorities respond to a report of a shooting at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg, Ore., Thursday. Myspace The gunman was identified as 26-year-old Chris Harper Mercer. Ryan Kang/AP A woman is comforted as friends and family wait for students at the local fairgrounds after the shooting. Mike Sullivan/AP Police search students outside Umpqua Community College in Roseburg, Ore., Thursday. JOSH EDELSON/AFP/Getty Images Mourners react during a vigil in Roseburg, Ore. Thursday. Previous Next Enlarge This is a developing story. Please check back for updates.
